item.title: Supreme Court grants ex-IAS trainee Puja Khedkar interim protection from arrest - The Indian Express
item.description:
Supreme Court Grants Puja Khedkar Interim Protection from Arrest

Date: January 15, 2025, Source: Indian Express

The Supreme Court has granted interim protection from arrest to former IAS trainee Puja Khedkar, who is accused of fraudulently clearing the civil services examination conducted by the UPSC.

  • The Supreme Court issued a notice on Khedkar's appeal against a Delhi High Court order denying her anticipatory bail.
  • The court has ordered that no coercive actions be taken against her until the next hearing on February 14.
  • Khedkar has been accused of cheating and improperly using OBC and disability benefits in the civil services exam.
  • She has denied all allegations and claims that the prosecution's case is based on accessible documentary evidence.
  • A Delhi court previously dismissed her plea for anticipatory bail, citing strong indications of her intent to deceive the complainant, UPSC.
“Prima facie, it is established that the conduct of the petitioner has been truly driven with the motive to dupe the complainant.”

This case highlights significant legal proceedings involving allegations of systemic fraud in civil services recruitment, affecting perceptions of the integrity of public examinations.

item.title: Train link to Kashmir a step closer to tracks, gets safety clearance for last leg between Katra and Reasi - The Indian Express
item.description:
Train to Kashmir Soon as Last Leg of Project Gets Safety Clearance

Date: January 15, 2025 Source: Indian Express

The long-awaited rail link to Kashmir is set to begin operations as the final segment, the Katra-Reasi section, has received safety clearance from authorities.

  • The Commissioner of Railway Safety approved the Katra-Reasi stretch after a detailed investigation.
  • Due to security concerns, trains will operate only during daylight hours.
  • The maximum speed for trains between Katra and Reasi has been set at 85 km/h.
  • The first service will include an eight-coach Vande Bharat train capable of operating in severe winter conditions.
  • The project, initiated in 1994-95, faced significant challenges including difficult terrain and the need for advanced construction techniques.
“Now, the entire link is getting connected and the dream of a train to Kashmir will come true soon.” – Dinesh Chand Deshwal, CRS

This project marks a significant advancement in connecting Jammu with Srinagar through rail, enhancing accessibility and potentially promoting tourism and economic development in the region.

item.description:

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: News18

The Karnataka High Court has lifted the stay on the Lokayukta probe in the MUDA scam involving Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, directing the investigation to continue with a report due by January 27.

  • A directive was made for the Lokayukta to present all documentation gathered to date.

  • Justice M Nagaprasanna emphasized the importance of a detailed and impartial investigation.
  • Future hearings are set with deadlines for report submissions and case reviews.
“Lokayukta to place on record the details of investigation conducted till today. The investigation by Lokayukta shall continue…” - Justice M Nagaprasanna

This recent development moves forward the investigations into the allegations against Siddaramaiah, signifying a critical juncture in the case.

item.title: Meet IIT Baba, aerospace engineer whose quest for truth led him to spiritualism - India Today
item.description:
Meet IIT Baba, aerospace engineer whose quest for truth led him to spiritualism

Published On: Jan 15, 2025

Source: India Today

At the Maha Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj, Baba Abhay Singh, known as 'IIT Baba', shares his journey from an IIT-Bombay aerospace engineer to a spiritual seeker. His story is one of transformation, driven by a deep quest for knowledge and personal freedom.

  • Baba Abhay Singh, originally from Haryana, transitioned from engineering to arts before finding his path in spirituality.
  • Faced with familial challenges, including a difficult childhood, he turned to photography and education.
  • His journey involved exploring diverse subjects like Sanskrit, psychology, and the intersections of science and spirituality.
  • He emphasizes the importance of personal freedom and fluidity in spiritual practice, rejecting formal titles.
  • IIT Baba promotes yoga and Vedic teachings as pathways to spiritual liberation (moksha).
"I don't want to get stuck, I don't want to stop. When a man doesn't get stuck anywhere, then he becomes free."

Through his experiences, IIT Baba illustrates that the journey of exploration and introspection is crucial for personal and spiritual growth.

item.title: AAP's Sanjay Singh accuses Delhi poll official of secretly reposting BJP's X posts; DEO responds - Hindustan Times
item.description:
AAP's Sanjay Singh Accuses Delhi Poll Official of Secretly Reposting BJP Posts

Date: January 15, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MP Sanjay Singh has accused the New Delhi district election officer of secretly reposting posts from the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on social media.

  • Elections for the Delhi legislative assembly are scheduled for February 5, with results on February 8.
  • Singh shared a screenshot showing the district election officer's repost of a BJP post featuring party leaders.
  • He claimed this is unprecedented in India, suggesting the DEO has political affiliations with the BJP.
  • The DEO responded, clarifying that the repost was inadvertent and claiming to promote accuracy in official communication.
  • The Social Media Cell responsible for the DEO's social media has been reorganized to prevent future errors.
“For the first time in the history of India - Election Officer of New Delhi started retweeting BJP's tweets secretly.” - Sanjay Singh

This incident raises concerns over the impartiality of election officials ahead of the crucial assembly elections.

item.title: Strictest pollution curbs back in Delhi: Construction banned, hybrid classes on - India Today
item.description:
Strictest Pollution Curbs Back in Delhi: Construction Banned, Hybrid Classes On

Published On: Jan 15, 2025 | Source: India Today

Authorities in Delhi-NCR have implemented the strictest pollution measures due to worsening air quality conditions, leading to significant restrictions on construction and classes.

  • Air Quality Index (AQI) reached 386, categorized as 'Very Poor'.
  • All construction activities have been banned under Stage-4 of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP).
  • Hybrid classes for students in grades 6-9 and 11 may be initiated.
  • Non-essential polluting trucks are barred from entering Delhi.
  • Favorable weather conditions, vehicle emissions, and other pollution sources contribute to the deteriorating situation.
“We have seen a significant rise in pollution levels, the AQI jumped from 275 to nearly 400 in just a day.”

These measures are part of a broader response to control air quality in the region, aiming to tackle both immediate and long-term environmental concerns.

item.title: Duty Of Government & Local Authorities To Provide Basic Toilet & Sanitation Facilities Within Court... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Directs Construction of Toilets in Court Premises for Inclusivity

Publication Date: January 15, 2023 Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court of India has issued directives for the establishment of toilet facilities in court premises across the country, emphasizing the need for privacy and safety for women and transgender individuals.

  • The initiative comes after a writ petition highlighted the absence of basic sanitation facilities for all genders in courts.
  • The court referenced constitutional provisions and accessibility guidelines to support its decision.
  • It emphasized the importance of clean public toilets for public health and human dignity.
  • The directive requires state governments to allocate funds for construction and maintenance of these facilities.
  • A status report from all High Courts and States/UTs is mandated within four months to ensure compliance.
“The entire analysis makes it abundantly clear that public health is of paramount importance...”

This ruling reflects a commitment to improving sanitation facilities within the judicial system, ensuring dignity and safety for all individuals accessing courts.

item.title: Arvind Kejriwal net worth: A look at ex-Delhi CM's assets, how his income changed in 5 years - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Arvind Kejriwal net worth: A look at ex-Delhi CM's assets, how his income changed in 5 years

Date: January 15, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Arvind Kejriwal, the national convenor of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), has seen a marginal increase in his family net worth over the past five years, rising from Rs 3.4 crore to Rs 4.2 crore.

  • Kejriwal declared net assets totaling Rs 1.73 crore in his affidavit.
  • His assets include bank savings of Rs 2.96 lakh and cash of Rs 50,000.
  • He owns immovable assets worth Rs 1.7 crore but has no car or house listed.

"Kejriwal’s declared family net worth has increased marginally from Rs 3.4 crore to Rs 4.2 crore over five years."

Overall, the couple’s total net worth amounts to Rs 4.23 crore, showing a steady increase in their declared assets over time.

item.title: UP: Meerut hospital director, 5 others booked for 'removing' woman's kidney - Hindustan Times
item.description:
UP: Meerut hospital director, 5 others booked for 'removing' woman's kidney

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A case has been registered against six individuals, including the director of a private hospital in Meerut, for allegedly conducting an illegal kidney removal from a patient in 2017.

  • The case was initiated after the victim, Kavita Devi, filed a complaint claiming that her kidney was removed during treatment.
  • The complaint alleges illegal organ trade and threats from hospital staff when she sought accountability.
  • The hospital has denied the allegations and claimed the accusations are an attempt at extortion.
  • The police have registered the FIR under various IPC sections and the Transplantation of Human Organs Act.
“The doctor advised surgery, assuring me it would address internal health issues. However, further tests revealed that my left kidney was missing,” - Kavita Devi.

This incident highlights serious concerns regarding medical ethics and patient rights within healthcare facilities.

item.title: GRAP-4 restrictions reimposed in Delhi-NCR as air quality worsens - The Hindu
item.description:
GRAP-4 restrictions reimposed in Delhi-NCR as air quality worsens

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

The Centre's panel on Delhi-NCR's air quality has reimposed curbs under stage 4 of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) due to a sharp decline in air quality. Meteorological conditions have contributed to a significant rise in the air quality index (AQI), prompting immediate action.

  • Air quality index soared to 396 on January 15, 2025.
  • Stage 4 curbs include banning construction activities and entry of non-essential polluting trucks.
  • School classes for grades other than 10 and 12 shifted to hybrid mode.
  • Non-essential diesel trucks banned from entering Delhi.
  • CAQM directed immediate action under stages 3 and 4 due to worsening air quality forecasts.
The India Meteorological Department predicts AQI may breach the 400 mark soon.

This decision is aimed at combating hazardous air quality levels that particularly worsen during winter months in the Delhi-NCR region.

item.description:
NEET PG 2024 Counselling: MCC To Fill 24,314 Seats In Round 3 After Cut-Off Reduction

Date: January 15, 2025

Source: News18

The Medical Counselling Committee (MCC) has announced significant updates regarding the NEET PG 2024 counselling process, with 24,314 vacancies available for Round 3 due to a reduction in cut-offs aimed at filling vacant seats.

  • The MCC has announced 15,902 virtual vacancies for Round 3, allowing candidates to update or vacate their previously allotted seats.
  • A total of 8,313 clear vacancies have been identified, along with 99 new seats added for Round 3 across various states.
  • Revised cut-offs now allow General Category/EWS candidates with 15 percentile and above, and SC/ST/OBC/PwD candidates with 10 percentile to participate in counselling.
  • Registration for Round 3 will end by 12 PM on January 15, 2025, and candidates can choose preferences until 8 AM on January 16, 2025.
  • Reporting to allotted colleges will be from January 18 to January 25, 2025.
“The cut-offs were lowered to prevent PG seats in medical colleges from remaining vacant.”

This initiative is aimed at maximizing the admission rates for NEET PG, ensuring that more candidates can secure their places in medical colleges across India.

item.title: Supreme Court calls for separate toilets for men, women, PwD, transgender persons in all courts - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Mandates Separate Toilets in All Courts for Men, Women, PwD, and Transgender Persons

Published on: 15 Jan 2025, 2:28 pm

The Supreme Court has issued a pivotal directive for all states and High Courts to provide separate toilet facilities for men, women, persons with disabilities, and transgender individuals at court premises, emphasizing sanitation as a human right.

  • All States and High Courts must construct separate toilet facilities for men, women, PwD, and transgender persons.
  • These facilities must be identifiable and accessible to judges, advocates, litigants, and court staff.
  • States must allocate sufficient funds for construction and maintenance of these facilities.
  • Toilets should contain stocked sanitary pad dispensers where applicable.
“Access to proper sanitation is recognized as a fundamental right under Article 21 of the Constitution.”

This ruling was made in response to a petition advocating for the need for separate restroom facilities, addressing the basic human rights linked to sanitation in the justice system.

Delhi pollution: Centre imposes GRAP 4 restrictions as air quality worsens in Capital

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The Indian government has implemented GRAP 4 restrictions in response to worsening air quality in Delhi. These measures aim to control pollution levels and improve public health.

  • The air quality in Delhi has severely declined, prompting urgent governmental action.
  • GRAP (Graded Response Action Plan) Level 4 includes various restrictions to mitigate pollution.

“The air quality in Delhi poses a significant risk to public health and requires immediate action,” a health officials stated.

item.title: GRAP 4 restrictions back in Delhi-NCR amid rising pollution levels - Hindustan Times
item.description:
GRAP 4 Restrictions Reimposed in Delhi-NCR Due to Rising Pollution Levels

Date: Jan 15, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Central Government has re-imposed GRAP IV restrictions in the Delhi-NCR as the air quality has worsened significantly. This decision comes after Stage 3 restrictions were revoked due to a temporary improvement in air quality.

  • GRAP IV restrictions include a complete ban on all construction activities.
  • Non-essential polluting trucks are prohibited from entering Delhi.
  • Schools will shift to online classes except for classes 10 and 12.
  • Stage 4 is activated due to extremely poor air quality, categorized as 'Severe Plus' (AQI above 450).
  • The decision was made by the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM).
“All actions of the GRAP schedule shall be implemented, monitored and reviewed by all the agencies concerned in the entire NCR to ensure that the AQI levels do not slip further.”

This move aims to protect residents from hazardous air quality during winter months, which is exacerbated by local pollution sources.

item.title: Stricter Pollution Curbs Under GRAP-4 Reimposed In Delhi - NDTV
item.description:
Stricter Pollution Curbs Under GRAP-4 Reimposed In Delhi

Publication Date: October 25, 2023 | Source: The Commission for Air Quality Management

With dense fog enveloping Delhi and the air quality index hovering dangerously close to the 'severe' category, the Centre's anti-pollution panel has reimposed stricter pollution curbs in the capital and surrounding areas.

  • Stricter measures under GRAP-3 were revoked only recently; GRAP-4 measures have not been in effect since December 24.
  • The air quality index (AQI) has climbed to 396, likely to exceed the 400 mark.
  • Action has been taken under Stage-III and Stage-IV of the GRAP to tackle the severe air quality.
  • Restrictions include the use of certain vehicles, potential closure of physical classes, work from home measures, and bans on truck traffic.
“In an effort to prevent further deterioration of the air quality, the Sub Committee on GRAP hereby decides to straightway invoke ALL actions under Stage-III and Stage-IV of extant Schedule of GRAP...”

In conclusion, the reintroduction of these measures underscores the urgent need to address the critical air quality situation in Delhi and its adjoining regions.

item.title: Why India is reaching out to the Taliban now - BBC.com
item.description:
Why India is Engaging with the Taliban: A New Diplomatic Approach

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: BBC News

India's recent diplomatic outreach to the Taliban government of Afghanistan marks a notable change in its approach towards regional geopolitics. This engagement follows a significant strategic setback for India after the Taliban's return to power three years ago.

  • India's top diplomat, Vikram Misri, met with Taliban's acting foreign minister, Amir Khan Muttaqi, the highest-level discussion since Kabul's fall.
  • The meeting signaled the Taliban's interest in enhancing political and economic ties with India.
  • India aims to leverage trade opportunities and enhance connectivity through Iran's Chabahar port.
  • Experts suggest this outreach grants the Taliban a degree of international legitimacy.
  • India has invested heavily in humanitarian efforts in Afghanistan, fostering goodwill among the Afghan people.
“The fact that this treatment is coming from India— a nation that never previously had friendly relations with the Taliban— makes this all the more significant...” - Michael Kugelman, Wilson Center

In conclusion, India's engagement with the Taliban serves its interest in regional stability and connectivity, amid a complex and challenging geopolitical environment.

item.title: Kumbh Mela, explained: Its mythology, history, astrology, and why millions flock to it - The Indian Express
item.description:
Kumbh Mela, explained: Its mythology, history, astrology, and why millions flock to it

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

The Kumbh Mela takes place in Prayagraj, attracting millions of devotees who seek spiritual merit by bathing in the sacred rivers during the festival. This ancient event blends mythology and astrology, making it one of the largest gatherings in the world.

  • The Kumbh Mela is celebrated every 12 years in four locations: Haridwar, Prayagraj, Ujjain, and Nashik.
  • The festival's origins are linked to a myth involving gods and demons churning the ocean for the elixir of immortality.
  • Devotees believe that bathing in the rivers during Kumbh washes away sins.
  • The festival also serves as a meeting point for sadhus and an opportunity for the public to learn from them.
  • The next Maha Kumbh will be held in Prayagraj from January 13 to February 26, 2025.
“While the importance of the Ganga in Hindu religion is well-known, the Kshipra is believed to have emerged from the heart of Vishnu in his Varah avatar.” - Dr. Dipakbhai Jyotishacharya

The Kumbh Mela remains a profound cultural and religious phenomenon, drawing immense participation and showcasing the rich traditions of Hinduism.

item.description:
UP School Holiday: Sambal, Bareilly, & others extend winter vacations due to coldwave

Publication Date: January 15, 2025 Source: Indian Express

Amid the cold wave conditions in North India, various districts in Uttar Pradesh have extended the winter vacations for school students up to Class 8.

  • Schools in Meerut, Mathura, Kanpur, Agra, Varanasi, Prayagraj, Amethi, Barabanki, Gorakhpur, and Ballia are open for all classes.

  • In Ghaziabad, winter vacations for classes 1 to 8 have been extended until January 18.
The School Education Department in Jammu and Kashmir has also announced a winter holiday schedule.

Students are advised to stay in touch with their respective schools for information regarding the holiday schedule.
